explains: adj. 吵闹的；骚乱的；狂暴的

sentences.en: His predecessor was accorded an equally tumultuous welcome.
sentences.cn: 他的前任受到了同样热烈的欢迎。

sentences.en: A tumultuous welcome from a 2,000 strong crowd greeted the champion.
sentences.cn: 多达2千之众的人群热闹欢腾地迎接冠军。

sentences.en: They became civic heroes and received a tumultuous ovation on their appearance in New York City.
sentences.cn: 他们成了平民英雄，在纽约市一露面就迎来了一阵激动的欢呼。
